results.title: The Baby of Macon
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Kees Kasander, La Sept, UGC Images and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Peter Greenaway’s film is visually sumptuous and confronting. Inspired by images of billboards featuring young children as icons, Greenaway’s film is set in the seventeenth century where child martyrs were similarly exploited. Rape, death, dismemberment occur when a miraculous child is the subject of a play that becomes too real. Stars Ralph Fiennes and Julia Ormond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Greenaway, Kees Kasander, La Sept, UGC Images and Channel Four

results.title: The Aviators of Hudson Strait
results.brief_description: A look at early Canadian aviation, through film footage shot by the Royal Canadian Air Force and the recollections of retired Air Vice-Marshal Thomas A. Lawrence, leader of the 1927-28 aerial survey expedition to Ungava Bay and Hudson Strait. The formidable challenge of flying under Arctic conditions, the hazards faced and the emergencies solved, often with the help of Inuit, make an absorbing chapter of northern frontier history. Written by William Weintraub.

results.title: The Au Harem D'archimede = Tea in the harem
results.brief_description:
“The narrative centers on the adventures of a couple of eighteen-year-olds, Madjid, a Beur and Pat, his illiterate French friend. However, the loose episodic structure of the narrative, covering a week or so in the lives of people living on the ironically named Flowers Estate, allows other stories to be intercalated, particularly that of Josette, a single mother who loses her job and is driven to attempt suicide, and Malika, Madjid’s mother, who not only holds her own family together, but also provides support for other women on the estate who are unable to cope. The film is primarily interested in exploring Madjid’s conflicts of identity, torn between the (unrealistic) expectations his mother has of him as an Algerian and his experiences on the streets of Paris with Pat.” Reference: Carrie Tarr. Questions of identity in Beur cinema: from ‘Tea in the Harem’ to ‘Cheb’. Screen 34:4 (Winter 1993).Awards: Prix Jean Vigo 1984.

Credits: Producer, Michele Ray-Gavras ; director, Mehdi Charef ; writer, Mehdi Charef ; photography, Dominique Chapuis ; music, Karim Kacel
Cast: Kader Boukhanef, Remi Martin, Laure Duthilleul, Saida Bekkouche, Nicole Hiss.

results.title: The Apostle
results.creator_credit: Robert Duvall, Rob Carliner and Butchers Run Films
results.brief_description: Robert Duvall wrote, directed and stars in this tale of a deeply troubled Southern Pentecostal preacher, Sonny, which explores issues of spirituality and faith. Sonny is a gifted preacher much loved by his community, but after he loses control and commits a crime of passion, he is forced to flee from the law. Settling in the small town of Bay Boutte, he adopts a new identity and sets out on a new mission - to find the road to redemption. Cast includes: Robert Duvall, Farrah Fawcett, Miranda Richardson, Todd Allen and Billy Bob Thornton.

results.title: The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle
results.creator_credit: Des McAnuff, Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, Dritte Beteiligung KC Median AG and Co and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: 35 years after the cancellation of the successful cartoon show “Rocky & Bullwinkle” and there is a plea for them to save the world when evil cold war cohorts Fearless Leader (Robert De Niro), Boris (Jason Alexander) and Natasha (Rene Russo) find a way of making it from being an animated character to a real one. Fearless Leader plans to buy up as much cable television time as possible for their program RBTV (really bad television) and feed mindless drivel to the masses, turn them into zombies, and provide malleable intellects to support his plans for being president. FBI agent Karen Sympathy (Piper Perabo) brings the moose and the squirrel back into the real world and takes a road trip with her cartoon heroes in pursuit of Fearless Leader. An impressive blend of animation and live action, the cast also includes Randy Quaid and features cameos by John Goodman, Billy Crystal and Whoopi Goldberg. Pitched at both adults and children, there are sight gags and corny puns as well as plenty of irony for those that can notice. Written by Kenneth Lonergan and based on characters developed by Jay Ward.

results.title: The Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley
results.brief_description: Mystery, action and songs abound as Detectives Mary-Kate and Ashley undertake a set of daring advetures. These trenchcoat twins and their dog Clue live by their agency motto to “solve any crime by dinner time.”

results.title: The Adventures of Marco Polo
results.creator_credit: Archie Mayo, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper stars as 13th Century explorer and adventurer Marco Polo, the Venetian who opened the trade route from Europe to China. At the court of the great Kublai Khan, ruler of the Mongol Empire, Marco battles the intrigue of the court to win the admiration of the great Khan and the love of a beautiful Princess (Sigrid Guthrie). A classic historical drama filled with spectacular battle scenes, panoramas, opulent sets and costumes. Co-starring Basil Rathbone.

results.title: The Adventures of Barry McKenzie
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Phillip Adams and Longford
results.brief_description: Barry Crocker plays Barry McKenzie, a wild colonial who heads off for London with a legacy left to him by an uncle. He makes straight for Earls Court to join up with his mates, and from there rampages through London with his Aunt Edna (Barry Humphries), “cracking tubes”, “chundering”, and “pointing Percy in the snake’s room” all the way. His adventures culminate in an interview, (minus his trousers), with Joan Blakewell and the BBC. Dennis Price, in one of the last films he made before he died, with Spike Milligan and Peter Cook add their comic talents to this ‘adventurous’ movie.

results.title: Texasville
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Barry Spikings, Cine-Source and Nelson Entertainment
results.brief_description: Twenty years after his acclaimed “The Last Picture Show”, Peter Bogdanovich returns to the small town of Texasville to investigate what happened to the characters who inhabited the initial film. Duane (Jeff Bridges) is now an oil businessman whose company is going broke and his marriage to the vivacious Karla (Annie Potts) is on the rocks. A chance encounter with his old high school flame Jayce (Cybil Shepherd) precipitates a mid-life crisis for Duane and he begins to question his philandering and his refusal to let go of the past. The performances are what makes this film wonderful, with excellent performances by the entire cast. Engaging and humane, “Texasville” is a bittersweet elegy to growing old and the slowly extinguishing values of small-town life. Based on the novel by Larry McMurty.

results.title: Talk
results.creator_credit: Megan McMurchy, Suitcase Films, Australian Film Commission and Susan Lambert
results.brief_description: Susan Lambert’s first feature film is a witty commentary on 90’s relationships and lifestyles. Two close women friends spend a day together. Their frank and funny conversations reveal hidden desires, erotic secrets, painful confessions and a bizarre fantasy that has unexpected results. Angie Milliken as Stephanie and Victoria Longley as Julia capture the strengths and confusion of women in their 30’s who mistakenly think they might want to trade lives. These women do not simply talk but, by the film’s conclusion, are empowered by their mutual support and easy confidence to act as well. Co-starring Richard Roxburgh, Jacqueline McKenzie and John Jarratt.
